hints_html: Which differentiation rule will you need here?
hints_latex: Which differentiation rule will you need here?
hints_raw: Which differentiation rule will you need here?
question: 5 (b)
sols_html:
Here we will be using the chain rule:

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle ( p(q(x)) )' = p'(q(x)) \cdot q'(x)\end{aligned}\]

Here we have that

\[\begin{aligned} \displaystyle p(x) = e^x \quad q(x) = \sqrt{x}\end{aligned}\]

And so

\[\begin{aligned} g'(x) &= p'(q(x)) \cdot q'(x) \\ &= e^{\sqrt{x}} \left( \frac{1}{2\sqrt{x}} \right) \\ &= \frac{e^{\sqrt{x}}}{2\sqrt{x}}\end{aligned}\]
sols_raw:
Here we will be using the chain rule:
:<math>\displaystyle
( p(q(x)) )' = p'(q(x)) \cdot q'(x)
</math>

Here we have that
:<math>\displaystyle
p(x) = e^x \quad q(x) = \sqrt{x}
</math>

And so
:<math>\begin{align}
g'(x) &= p'(q(x)) \cdot q'(x) \\
&= e^{\sqrt{x}} \left( \frac{1}{2\sqrt{x}} \right) \\
&= \frac{e^{\sqrt{x}}}{2\sqrt{x}}
\end{align}</math>
statement_html:
Differentiate the following function.

\[\begin{aligned} g(x) = e^{\sqrt{x}}\end{aligned}\]
